definition: first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

sentences.english: I hope he can redeem himself.
sentences.chinese: 希望他能夠痛改前非，走上正軌。

sentences.english: I don't see a double dip... The recovery is on track.
sentences.chinese: 我不覺得是雙谷衰退，經濟復甦已經走上正軌。

sentences.english: The car has slowly, hard into the track.
sentences.chinese: 車子又緩緩的，艱難的駛入了正軌。

sentences.english: Our mission is to help them get back on track before it's too late.
sentences.chinese: 我們的任務是趁着爲時未晚，幫助他們回到正軌。

sentences.english: I have moved beyond freedom into living a life on purpose.
sentences.chinese: 我已經超越了自由，將我的生活挪入了正軌。

sentences.english: Now I'm more serene, our daily life has re-started.
sentences.chinese: 現在我已經恢復平靜了，我們的生活重回正軌。

sentences.english: Then consider practical strategies for keeping your fitness program on track.
sentences.chinese: 然後再考慮能使健身計劃步入正軌的實用的策略。

sentences.english: She was grateful to her companion for not tempting her to swerve.
sentences.chinese: 她感謝她的同伴沒有誘使她脫離正軌。

sentences.english: I love you and want our marriage to work.
sentences.chinese: 我愛你，我希望我們的婚姻步入正軌。

sentences.english: Toss all those feelings out. And get the hell off your ass and back on track.
sentences.chinese: 拋掉所有這些感覺，扔掉這些糟糕的情緒，重回正軌。

sentences.english: Unexpectedly, Cabell was one of those who put things back on track.
sentences.chinese: 出乎意料的是，卡貝爾成了那個把一切拉回正軌的人。

sentences.english: After a big afternoon run-up, Forester thought everything might be back on track.
sentences.chinese: 下午股市大漲之後，佛瑞斯特認爲一切終於迴歸正軌。

sentences.english: How did I get the client back on track?
sentences.chinese: 我是如何幫助這家公司找到癥結，走上正軌？

sentences.english: The letter of intent puts the initiative on a more formal footing.
sentences.chinese: 這份意向書的簽署，使得該計劃步上正軌。

sentences.english: The farm life was getting on its right track.
sentences.chinese: 農場的生活走上了正軌，我被分配到管水班。

sentences.english: Politicians pay close attention to right-track/wrong-track indicators.
sentences.chinese: 政治家密切注意是否走上正軌的指標。
